summary: The Louvre is a famous art museum in Paris, France, located on the Right Bank of the Seine River. It was originally a medieval fortress but was converted into a royal residence in the 16th century. The museum opened in 1793, displaying royal and church art. Today, it has over 500,000 objects and 35,000 artworks, including the Mona Lisa and Venus de Milo. The collection covers Egyptian antiquities, sculptures, paintings, and more. With around 9 million visitors in 2023, it is the world's most-visited museum.
title: Louvre
